note.p: Education: Stockport Grammar School; Merton College, Oxford; BA (1696); Brasenose College, Oxford; MA (1699), BD (1710), DD (1710)

Career: Fellow of Brasenose; Professor of Music at Gresham College, London (1705-1710); Rector of Great Billing, Northamptonshire (1710-1712); Master of Brasenose (1710-1745); Rector of Whitechapel, Middlesex (1716); Vice-Chancellor of Oxford (1718-1723); Rector of Amersham, Buckinghamshire (1744)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB (Shippen, William); Foster; Ward
